In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    wrapped_str = ""
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width 
            wrapped_str *= "\n" * word 
            line = ""
        else 
            line *= " " * word 
        end 
    end
    
    return wrapped_str * "\n" * line
end
```

You can test the function with an example string:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nullam id dictum sapien.", 30))
```
